title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) components, designed to serve as a personal project management and organization tool. Leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and state management, the project showcases a practical implementation of modern web development best practices within a typed environment. It encompasses key topics such as project structure, component composition, and effective data handling in a Next.js application.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS. This project focuses on providing real-time data visualization and command execution for Robofleet-enabled robots, allowing users to track robot status, manage tasks, and analyze performance metrics. It aims to simplify robot fleet management and provide a user-friendly experience for interacting with robotic systems.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple yet effective web application for managing and tracking personal expenses using CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations. Built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, this project utilizes Material-UI components for a clean and intuitive user interface. The repository showcases practical application of CRUD principles in a real-world scenario, providing a solid foundation for learning full-stack development and front-end frameworks.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and converted to HTML for easy online viewing. The project showcases my skills and experience in a clean, accessible format and serves as a central location for my resume materials.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, aiming to [Insert project's main goal here, taken from README or inferred purpose, e.g., "provide a streamlined note-taking experience" or "experiment with modern web development frameworks"]. Leveraging the power of these languages, it explores [mention specific topics the project touches upon, e.g., "state management," "UI components," or "serverless functions"]. This repository serves as a learning platform and a demonstration of effective software development practices.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a functional dashboard interface. This repository serves as a practical example of implementing a robust and visually appealing dashboard using cutting-edge web development technologies, providing a solid foundation for learning and building complex web applications.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to be a simple and effective idea management tool. This repository provides a flexible platform to capture, organize, and develop ideas, fostering collaboration and innovation. It's a great starting point for personal projects or team brainstorming sessions, leveraging modern web technologies for a seamless user experience.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. By logging sleep schedules and comparing them to ideal sleep requirements, the tracker provides insights into accumulated sleep loss and encourages healthier sleep habits. This project serves as a practical application of TypeScript and demonstrates web development principles for personal well-being.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for creating and participating in polls and voting systems. This project showcases modern web development practices, including server-side rendering, API routes, and a user-friendly interface, focusing on delivering a seamless and engaging voting experience.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, and CSS, designed as a project demonstrating fundamental web development principles. It allows users to perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations on data, showcasing the integration of a Python-based backend with a relational database and a user-friendly web interface, addressing key topics in web application development and deployment.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on map visualization, built using a combination of HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing or backend logic. It leverages these technologies to present and interact with geographical data, offering a visual representation of information linked to specific locations on a map. The project explores techniques for displaying spatial data and allows for potential interactive exploration.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, provides a collection of projects focused on applying Python to financial analysis. It explores various finance-related topics, offering practical examples and code implementations for tasks such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and financial modeling. Ideal for anyone looking to learn how to leverage Python for financial data analysis and gain hands-on experience in the field.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets. This project leverages these technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring the location and status of connected devices, focusing on real-time updates and efficient data management within a scalable framework.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project implementing a dynamic and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository demonstrates how to create a responsive calendar interface that can be populated and managed with event data, providing a user-friendly experience for scheduling and viewing events.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide an interactive and engaging conversational experience. This project showcases a modern approach to building web applications using TypeScript for robust type safety, Vite.js for rapid development, and integrates with the Gemini API for intelligent text generation and dialogue, exploring practical applications of AI in user interaction.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on [Insert a brief, compelling purpose based on the README or inferred from the name - e.g., visualizing global data, simulating real-world interactions, showcasing a portfolio of web development skills, etc.]. This repository demonstrates practical application of modern web development technologies and explores concepts related to [Mention the primary topic or area the project addresses based on README or name].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface for parsing, filtering, and exploring log data, making it easier to debug and understand ROS-based systems. This project offers a convenient way to gain insights from ROS logs within a browser environment.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce platform built with Next.js 14 using the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query to provide a fast and efficient online shopping experience. Leveraging Material UI (MUI) for a clean and responsive design, this project serves as a practical example of a type-safe, full-stack application showcasing best practices for building e-commerce solutions. It aims to demonstrate effective data fetching, state management, and UI component integration within a Next.js environment.
